title: Rio Ferdinand sends emotional message to Man Utd players ahead of Liverpool clash
text:
Rio Ferdinand has told Manchester United’s players to ‘enjoy’ their clash with Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

Rio Ferdinand has urged Manchester United players to understand the ‘importance’ of their clash with Liverpool and ‘seize the opportunity’ at Old Trafford.

United head into the match with just two wins from their opening eight Premier League games, while Jurgen Klopp’s side are five points clear of Manchester City at the top of the table with a 100 per cent record.

To add to United’s woes, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has confirmed that both David de Gea and Paul Pogba will miss Sunday’s fixture.

Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Anthony Martial, Luke Shaw, Jesse Lingard, Phil Jones, Diogo Dalot and Mason Greenwood are also doubts ahead of kick-off.

Ferdinand has told United’s squad to play without fear and ‘enjoy’ the game, despite Liverpool being heavy favourites.

‘This Game Is That Big… The fact that even now after the many games we won, great comebacks, cup wins & #UCL nights…. I still get #mufc fans coming up to me saying “Rio, that goal against Liverpool was my childhood” or something of that nature.. (I have to ask what one as I have scored a couple of bangers against them!) But it just shows you what this game means to Manchester United & the fans,’ Ferdinand told his followers on Instagram.

‘As a player who comes into the club & who isn’t local you are quickly made aware what this game means to you – EVERYTHING.

‘You can’t lose, you leave everything on that pitch, you win your individual battles, you give their fans nothing to shout about, you send them back across the M62 in silence…I could go on!

Solskjaer will be without De Gea and Pogba at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty)

‘But it’s about every single one of the squad understanding the importance of Man Utd vs #LFC. You would see some new players, British or foreign, after a game sitting there wide eyed saying “I didn’t realise it was this mad & that the city gets so crazy leading up to the game”.

‘Losing just isn’t an option & today that couldn’t apply more. The position #MUFC are in adds even more pressure on the players. The players can’t see it like us fans though – thinking about all of the above just adds to the pressure of a game of this magnitude. The players have to see this game as a huge opportunity for themselves as individuals & as a team to be the catalyst for a bright new future by playing an important role in getting a win.

‘This is an opportunity to play a pivotal role in turning around the fortunes at this great club. That should make them excited going into this game not fearful – fear comes with not being able to handle the pressure. We can’t go there. Seize the opportunity should be the mentality going into this game. Go and do it.

‘Enjoy these moments, they are great……when you win! Good luck to the boys. Rio.’

Despite their miserable run of form, Solskjaer insists United’s clash with Liverpool comes at a ‘perfect’ time for his players.

‘That’s a perfect game for us,’ the Norwegian said following United’s defeat at Newcastle.

‘The international break is also at the perfect time because their heads need a bit of airing. It doesn’t help having a meeting tomorrow.

They will go away with their national teams, meet their team-mates and come back fresh.

‘We have had a good time together, we have prepared since the first day of pre-season, we have stuck to the same principles.

‘We have not got the result today but we have to keep carrying on.’
